title: I need help with colours!!
content:
Hello,

I’m in the final stages of developing this logo for my client. I am now stuck on finding a colour scheme that would most effectively define his service of teaching online jazz piano lessons. So, please review my 6 semi-final logos and let me know what colour scheme represnets JAZZ the most. If you don’t like any of them, then please let me know of another 3-colour RGB colour scheme.

Thanks!!!

Brian

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [jazzcolourschemes.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080516045658/http:/typophile.com/files/jazzcolourschemes.pdf) | 39.73 KB |

 [‹ Logotype nit-pick](http://web.archive.org/web/20080516045658/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33488 "Go to previous forum topic") [logo for a carpentry company ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080516045658/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33392 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bpotstra

comments.content:
Well, is this going to be just web-based or is there going to be a print version?

A, C, and D have the best contrast (IMO!) and would work with both....

Nothing is more jazz than the Blue Note album covers. Google them and take a look…

peace

thanks for the reply!

yes, this is going to be used in both web and print.  
I’ve been staring at these for the last few days so I’m not sure anymore... thanks fot your help!

Brian
I like A. And no just because I like it best. I actually like it.

Color? What’s this about color?!

Everybody typophile knows that you can  
choose any color as long as it’s black.

hhp
Try A with red where the orange is.

I like E (red and blue) and I like your logo.  
Also I am curious to see the A with the red as commented above.

I vote E

the others have a good color contrasts but are not “jazzy”

Thank you all so much for your replies! I’m going to keep pluggin away at is.  
I know this is a type forum, but its the colour that I’m struggling with! :)
